text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm this spicy chicken noodles that's
right in addition to showing you an easy
beautiful and delicious noodle dish I'm
also hoping to expose you to a very
specific type of noodle that you might
not be familiar with or at least not
using enough and that would be the rice
noodle okay remember that friend you
couldn't invite over for the pasta
dinner because they couldn't eat wheat
well if you use these rice noodles
you're going to have to think up another
excuse not to invite them but anyway
we'll get all that in a few minutes for
now let's go ahead and get started with
the other components the first of which
would be some chicken meat but for this
I'm going to use some already cooked
chicken breast that I've turned into
some large shreds and while this will
work with raw chicken and I'm totally
going to tell you how to do that on the
blog post this is one of those recipes
is just perfect for using up leftovers
so I went ahead and tore up our one
large chicken breast as shown and once
that said we can refrigerate until
needed and move on to the second
component which is our veggies in the
array I'm recommending starts with some
julienne carrots which you could do with
a knife that would take you like an hour
so instead you could always grate them
or use a peeler or like I did use one of
those vegetable shredders you ordered at
2:00 in the morning after seeing the
infomercial hey it happens to the best
of us I'm also going to add a nice big
handful of shredded cabbage as well as
some sliced red bell pepper which is of
course sweet and then for some heat will
also do a help enyo and then we'll
finish up with a handful of sliced green
onions and some crushed garlic and
that's it and it's at this point chefs
love to say hey you could also add
whatever leftover veggies you have in
your fridge which could be true but not
always I mean what if you have some
leftover steamed rutabagas do not put
those in this but anyway once our
vegetation congregation has been
assembled we will move on to the sauce
and we'll start that with a couple
spoons of hoisin also known as the
world's ugliest condiment
we will also add a splash of soy sauce
as well as a tablespoon of ketchup which
as you can see I measuring very very
carefully then we'll continue on with a
little bit of brown sugar as well as
some seasoned rice vinegar and then
since we are calling the spicy chicken
noodles we'll also go ahead and add some
hot sauce and of course how much and how
hot is going to be up to you
I mean you are after all the Yankee
doodles of your chicken noodles but
since like I said we are calling this
spicy you should have a good amount and
the same goes for adding some chili
flakes and if you're keeping score at
home those are from Korea the good korea
and then to finish this off i will do is
add some chicken broth and give it a
stir and if you're thinking that doesn't
look like a lot of sauce well you're
right
i really only want enough to coat our
vegetables and our noodles but if for
whatever reason you want more just go
ahead and make some more totally fine
and then once our sauce is set we can
move on to the final and most exciting
component our rice noodles they sort of
look like extra pale fettuccine and
basically sort of feels the same as we
baste pasta but the method of
preparation is much different instead of
bringing our noodles to hot boiling
salted water we're going to bring the
hot salted boiling water to the noodles
so what we're going to do is cover these
with about six cups of boiling salted
water and we'll give those a quick stir
and by the way this would have been the
perfect point to do the flashback to
when i learned this technique but anyway
like i said we're going to cover these
with boiling water and give them a stir
and we'll let these sit for exactly ten
minutes which should be enough time for
them to hydrate and soften and during
that ten minutes it's not a bad idea to
give mister once in a while oh by the
way times may vary depending on which
exact brand you use but it should be
listed on the package and then what
we'll want to do once the timer rings is
drain these and believe it or not rinse
them in cold water I know I told you to
never rinse but this is different
we need to cool these noodles down so we
will blast those with cold water and
then let those drain thoroughly before
transferring them into a mixing bowl
if everything has gone according to plan
they should look something like this and
then what I like to do is add our
shredded chicken to these cold noodles
and then drizzle over a tablespoon of
sesame oil which again I'm measuring
very very carefully and above and beyond
adding some richness and obviously
flavor that little bit of oil will also
prevent our noodles from sticking
together in case you're curious the only
reason added the chicken is because
we're going to add the noodles and the
chicken at the same point and this way I
can do that by just grabbing one Bowl
which reminds me now that all our
components are set we can begin final
production and to do that we will
drizzle some vegetable oil into our
largest skillet set over high heat and
one sec it's almost smoking hot we'll go
ahead and add our vegetable mixture and
cook that stirring for just a minute or
two okay all we want to happen here is
that our vegetables go from cold and raw
to basically hot steamy and still almost
raw so keep them moving buy a stir in
and or flip in and in about a minute or
two later you should have something that
looks like this okay like I said kind of
steamy and hot but those vegetables are
still pretty firm and once that's been
accomplished we can go ahead and pour in
our sauce and give that a stir and all
will do is let this cook on high heat
for about a minute until it starts to
bubble oh and if you're wondering if I
forgot the cornstarch in the sauce
mixture I did on purpose that's because
I prefer something with a little lighter
texture all right I really don't want to
thik gloppy starchy sauce but anyway
we'll pour that in and let it come back
up to temperature at which point we will
add our noodles and chicken and attempt
to stir all this together which yes
would have been easier in a bigger pan
but it's too late now plus life's too
short for regrets so I took my time and
once that sauce it coated those noodles
that came together a lot quicker and
then all we're going to do to finish
this recipe is simply continue to cook
this stirring until everything's heated
through we should only take a couple
minutes but you'll know everything will
be heated through and then what we'll do
once we decide is cook long enough is
turn off the heat and we will stir in
some freshly chopped cilantro which is
optional but highly recommended and
other than tasting this for salt and
maybe heat
we are done and ready to serve and we'll
go ahead and transfer that into some
kind of noodle friendly bowl and then to
finish mine I garnished with some extra
cilantro as well as some freshly sliced
green onions and that's it what I'm
calling spicy chicken noodles is done or
is it our done I'm not sure but either
way I'm ready to dig in with a fork not
chopsticks because I'm hungry and above
and beyond how beautiful this is and how
delicious it tastes and it really does
what I think you're going to find so
exciting about this is just how
addictive the texture of those rice
noodles are right they do have a similar
texture to an el dente pasta but unlike
wheat based noodles these have a
chewiness I find incredibly addictive in
fact I have a theory one reason pad thai
is so popular other than it tastes
amazing is because of the texture of the
rice noodles which I keep describing as
chewy but that really doesn't do it
justice so I think that's really the
biggest reason I want you to try this oh
and one last thing before we sign off as
good as this is as a hot noodle dish the
leftovers with maybe a little bit of
fresh lemon or lime squeezed in and an
extra tablespoon of oil makes one of the
best cold pasta salads of all time but
anyway that's it my take on spicy
chicken noodles it's really not so much
a recipe as it is noodles meat and
vegetables coated with literally every
Asian condiment I had my fridge but who
cares it looks good it tastes good and
is pretty easy so regardless of what you
put in or whether you enjoy this hot or
cold I really do hope you give it a try
soon so head over to food wishes calm
for all the ingredient amounts and more
info as usual and as always enjoy
you
